intro: Lipochaeta texana, commonly known as Texas lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, and its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs. Lipochaeta texana is generally drought-tolerant and is considered a hardy plant adapted to arid environments.
